title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 27, 2013
byline: Gigi Douban, Bruce Johnson, Rob Schmitz, D Gorenstein, Jeremy Hobson, Christopher Werth, David Gura, Johnny Niemann and David Brancaccio
teaser: As the we near the sequester deadline, how are other countries around the world such as China viewing the budget cuts? While President Obama made political waves with his call for an increase to the federal minimum wage during the State of the Union address, Germany is having its own debate about whether to have a minimum wage at all. And Cablevision is suing Viacom because the cable company says it shouldn't have to pay for channels that aren't popular with subscribers.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 27, 2013
description: As the we near the sequester deadline, how are other countries around the world such as China viewing the budget cuts? While President Obama made political waves with his call for an increase to the federal minimum wage during the State of the Union address, Germany is having its own debate about whether to have a minimum wage at all. And Cablevision is suing Viacom because the cable company says it shouldn't have to pay for channels that aren't popular with subscribers.
